div.p: NARRATOR: Yes! If the common belief were true, we would expect either to see no alcoholism in either group or the same low rates in both groups.

NARRATOR: However, the research indicated that as adults, those people who had a birth parent with alcoholism developed alcoholism four times more than those who did not have a birth parent with alcoholism...
even though they were all raised in homes without alcoholism.
NARRATOR: Based on the research, we now know that having a birth parent with alcoholism increases our biological risk.
